title: RSE Society Resource Collection
brief description: Huge collection of multiple resources over categories

title: Best Practices in Software Engineering
brief description: I found this course really helpful at the beginning of being an RSE and great intro to testing, licencing, documentation, and some good design tips.

title: Intermediate Research Software Development
brief description: This course (2-3.5h each day for five days) aims to teach a core set of established, intermediate-level software development skills and best practices for working as part of a team in a research environment using Python as an example programming language
estimated skill: testing, IDEs, code styles, software design & different programming paradigms, version control via Git

title: Intermediate Research Software Development (UoM)
brief description: ^Different version of above course with a NERC focus, by University of Manchester, uses pandas instead of numpy
estimated skill: Overall RSE, best practices - version control, testing, programming paradigms, collaboration, CI/CD

title: Journal of Open Research Software (JORS)
brief description: The Journal of Open Research Software (JORS) features peer reviewed Software Metapapers describing research software with high reuse potential.

title: Packaging and Publishing with Python
brief description: This course teaches best practices for organizing a project and publishing it using Python. Focus on sharing code within a lab and as published material.
estimated skill: project setups, IDEs, Conda & VirtualEnv, documentation (using Sphinx), testing

title: Building digital workforce capacity and skills for data-intensive science
brief description: This report looks at the human resource requirements for data-intensive science, focusing primarily on research conducted in the public sector, and the related challenges and training needs

title: RSE paper list
brief description: Zotero list on RSEng papers

title: Research Software Engineering with Python (Turing Institute)
brief description: 8-10 half-day course to get the skills needed to use Python in research software propjects. Cover not only Python specific aspects of software development (like structures and useful packages) but also side knowlegde like version control and advance structures.
estimated skill: programming in Python, version control, testing

title: Introduction to using Git and GitHub for software development
brief description: Introduction to version control using Git and sharing your code using GitHub. Delivered as part of Imerial College London Research Computing & Data Science master programme.

title: Further Git and GitHub for Effective Collaboration
brief description: More advance uses of Git for version control and using GitHub for collaborative software development.

title: Software Design and Architecture
brief description: Create an android app in Java and pay attention to a variety of software design concepts when doing that

title: ACM Learning Center
brief description: Collection of courses and books covering software and developer development and management

title: The Linux command line for scientific computing
brief description: Most HPCs required from users to have some familiarity with the linux command line. This interactive course bring to your screen those skills required to master bash, specifically for scientific computing. Delivered as part of Imerial College London Research Computing & Data Science master programme.

title: Code Refinery
brief description: A collection of Carpentry style courses that target some intermediate level skills
estimated skill: version control, documentation, jupyter, testing, design, code collaboration

title: Code Wars
brief description: An interactive code challenge website where you complete "katas" (i.e. small problems) in your language of choice and then compare your solutions to others on performance, length, etc.

title: Research Software Engineering with Python
brief description: A book written to be used as the material for a (potentially) semester-long course at the university level, although it can also be used for independent self-study. Focus on writing short programs that clean and analyze data in a reproducible way and how to use version control to keep track of what they have done, with the end goal of writing an actual software package to address a real research question.
estimated skill: Unix shell, version control using Git, use Make, testing, reproducibility/sustainability aspects

title: Time management skills for developers
brief description: Time management might be tricky, specially in software development where you don't only need to write code but also deal with other external inputs. This blog post aim to walk you thorugh some key aspects to help you manage your time appropriately, improve your perfornace and, to some extend, your mental health!

title: Software Design by Example
brief description: Complete a variety of exercises that exhibit a particular design concept (there is a Python version coming)

title: psyTeachR
brief description: Teaching material for reproducible data science

title: Festive stress: A research software engineerâ€™s perspective
brief description: Stress and mental health is a common topic in software developmnet. In this blogpost, Dave Horsfall give us a few tips and trick that have worked for him to help you manage your stress as an RSE.

title: Talking about mental health at RSECon22
brief description: In this blog post, and related video, Dave Horsfall gives an overview of the mental health issues often appearing in research software engineering, indicators of when things might be going wrong and possible steps you can take to help you improve your quality of life in that regard.

title: The Advanced Software Design Course
brief description: Some quite theoretical concepts in advanced software design. I am struggling to write something pithy about it. Looks interesting, but expensive

title: Archer2 online training courses
brief description: HPC and necessary fundamentals

title: Quick Guide to Scrum
brief description: High level, introductory material to help you iunderstand what scrum is, how it fits within Agile and what to expect from it.

title: Program Management for Open Source Projects
Hidden REF
brief description: The hidden REF is a campaign to recognise all research outputs and every role that makes research possible.

title: RSE leaders evidence bank
brief description: Resources for setting up an RSE group, contributed by existing RSE groups

title: How to cite software: current best practice [outdated?]
brief description: Introduction to the software citation principles, and how they can be applied, as part of the Software Citation Workshop

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
The Agile Coach
brief description: Comprehensive guide to Agile project management, its different flameworks and implementation details.

title: A Philosophy of Software Design
brief description: A book that has quite a high level overview of guiding software design principles

title: SSI Event Organisation Guide
brief description: This guide goes through the steps of organising an event and is structured around the way the Institute organises its workshops and events.

title: Interactive Data Tools
brief description: Interactive, data-driven visualization tools and web mapping applications

title: Righting Software: A Method for System and Project Design
Real Python
brief description: Extensive collection of Python-related guides and tutorials, for all levels. Some require a subscritpionl, but most of them all free.
